alert.note: Alert for Northwest Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 08 at 10:44AM EST until January 10 at 2:21PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Baltimore MD/Washington DC has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Maryland... Seneca Creek at Dawsonville affecting Northwest Montgomery zone. For the Seneca Creek...including Dawsonville...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Seneca Creek at Dawsonville. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night to early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Portions of the Seneca Creek Greenway are flooded. A small portion of Berryville Road west of Darnestown begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:50 AM EST Monday the stage was 2.4 feet, or 5.1 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 7.5 feet. - Please visit weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Mon Tue Tue Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7PM 1AM 7AM Stg Time Date Seneca Creek Dawsonville 7.5 2.4 Mon 9 am 2.3 2.3 2.2 7.9 7am Wed &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/washington or weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this evening at 645 PM EST.
